Ooo, a Havana cocktail... that's pineapple juice, lemon juice & this potent potable... sounds perfect

Toast Mr. Henderson with a Gin Rickey or this often non-alcoholic version; the Marvelous Mrs. Maisel orders one in a deli

The years have brought a sex change to the original 1844 poem about going here "& through the wood, to grandfather's house"
In "The Brothers Karamazov", he wrote, "Love all God's creation, the whole and every grain of sand in it"
A poem by Hoffmann von Fallersleben begins with these 4 words (one repeated); a later verse is now the German anthem
Vivian is an ambitious politician in "Vivian Grey", the first novel by this future prime minister of England
It comes before "point" to mean a position from which something is considered or viewed
The area of a plot of land, or more generally, a synonym for territory

In other words, lack of, scarcity, an inadequate amount
This middle name of Henry Longfellow came from his mother's side of the family
It's the width or thickness of a body
In mythology Vesta was goddess of the home & of this, found in the home
Parturition is a synonym for this 10-letter word
A wise bird in other cultures, it's the negative counterpart to the Phoenix in Chinese lore
Symbolizing abundance, it is linked to the horn of Zeus' nurse, which could be filled with any desire
This 4-letter wading bird was sacred to ancient Egyptians
Said to be borne by Constantine's army, the Labarum was a royal flag of Rome consisting of these 2 Greek letters, Christ's monogram
The tree of life has long been a symbol of this, Jewish mysticism with origins in the 12th century
Zach Braff's payout for an on-set bet: an outgoing message recorded by this fellow actor known as the "Voice of God"
Stephen Hawking waited 15 years--until he was sure--before conceding a bet about whether Cygnus X-1 is one of these (it is)
A bet with the rival team's mayor is now a Super Bowl tradition for Mayor Quinton Lucas of this city; his fave wager? Barbecue
Ancient writers say Cleopatra won a bet with Mark Antony by dissolving this gem in vinegar, then drinking it; must be nice, Cleo!
This German director "eats his shoe" is a 1980 documentary in which a bet is lost & as payment, a shoe is indeed eaten
"The Way of the Farmer" & "The Buck Stops Here" are chapters in David McCullough's biography of him
Dying of lung cancer, Paul Kalanithi attempted to answer what makes life worth living in "When Breath Becomes" this
The title of his 2024 memoir "Sonny Boy" refers to his mother's childhood nickname for him, not his character in "Dog Day Afternoon"
Spike Lee called "The Autobiography of" this civil rights leader "the most important book I'll ever read"
"Véra" is a Pulitzer Prize-winning bio of this Russian-born author's wife, muse, reader, secretary, editor & translator

clues.text: Mark Watney in this novel says, "I don't want to come off as arrogant here, but I'm the best botanist on the planet"

"The Three Stigmata of Palmer Eldritch" & "The Minority Report" are works from this writer whose middle name was Kindred
After the "bugs" attack Buenos Aires, Johnnie Rico is off to Klendathu for revenge in this classic

rounds.text: Headlines read of the fall of Hama on December 5, Homs on December 7 & this city on December 8
